alert.note: Alert for Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 6:10PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong gusty outflow winds ahead of weak showers will impact portions of central Elbert County through 700 PM MDT... At 608 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of strong, gusty winds, along a line extending from 8 miles southwest of Deer Trail to 8 miles southeast of Kiowa to 6 miles northwest of Elbert, or along a line extending from 31 miles northwest of Limon to 28 miles north of Colorado Springs. Movement was south at 0 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Elbert and Simla. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. The gusty winds will occur well ahead of thunderstorms or any weakening showers or sprinkles.

area.areaDesc: Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County
